sense.name: Adjust for better functioning.
sense.commentary: INCLUDES: TUNE UP Syntax includes: NP1[animate] TUNE (UP) NP2[concrete]
sense.examples: The mechanic tuned the engine. Custom programs tune server performance. Getting your car tuned up is an important step in any maintenance program.

sense.name: Adjust the pitches of a musical instrument.
sense.commentary: Includes: TUNE UP Syntax includes: (NP1[animate]) TUNE (UP) NP2[instrument)
sense.examples: My piano needs to be tuned up. The orchestra members expertly tuned their instruments.

sense.name: Regulate a device to receive or block a program.
sense.commentary: Includes: TUNE IN, TUNE OUT Note: can be used metaphorically. Syntax includes: NP1[human] TUNE (PP) NP2
sense.examples: Millions of people tune in to the program each week. I tuned the television to Channel 5. No matter how attentive your kids are, they always tune out at least half of the instructions. The CEO needs to tune into reality.
